body:
Hi again.

Below I copy some of the messages referred to the retries previously mentioned.

```
2015/05/19 12:04:42 kg.berlin.to/20150518/tree/typo3temp/Cache/Data/cache_classes/t3lib_cache_backend_abstractbackend: Received error: Upload failed - retry: googleapi: Error 403: User rate limit exceeded, userRateLimitExceeded - retrying 1/10
```

Best regards,
Daniel

Thanks for the report.

This is a known problem see #28 which I haven't managed to get to the bottom of yet!

Can I check which version of rclone you are using?

It is possibly the retries which cause the problem, and it is possibly Drive being inconsistent at the time that the retry is done and not showing the file that has just been uploaded, causing rclone to make a new one.

To fix the problem I really need a reproduction of the problem on my laptop, but I haven't managed to make that yet.

If you could help with that that would be really useful.

Thanks

Nick

Hi, Nick.

Thank you very much for your answer.

Yes, I had seen the issue #28, but I wanted to mention the inconvenience I was having in case it was not related to that.

This is the version of rclone I'm using:

```
# ./rclone -V
rclone v1.13
```

It is the binary version downloaded from [here](http://rclone.org/downloads).

I found this problem by transferring a large amount of data (approximately 2.5 GB). After deleting all the data and re-do a new attempt, these were the results:

Initial synchronization:

```
Transferred:   2814288092 Bytes ( 238.09 kByte/s)
Errors:                 8
Checks:                 0
Transferred:        23384
Elapsed time:  3h12m23.442490003s
```

Here I see a transfer time too high. Is  "normal" that it happen or it may be related to the retries? Considering the message `User rate limit exceeded, userRateLimitExceeded` that I mentioned above, I have conducted several tests using the `--bwlimit=` option (gradually decreasing the value looking to find some where I don't get this message) reaching values as low as 50k and still I got the message `User rate limit exceeded`.

But these errors appear randomly. For example, on a second synchronization on the data transferred earlier, no errors occur and 9 files are transferred (I guess the files related to the previous 8 errors):

```
Transferred:       468865 Bytes (   1.90 kByte/s)
Errors:                 0
Checks:             23375
Transferred:            9
Elapsed time:  4m0.498335311s
```

A third synchronization finishes without errors, but with a duplicate file:

```
[...]

2015/05/19 16:55:35 zahnarzt.berlin.to/20150518/tree/fileadmin/user_upload/right_images/Zahntechnik_Aufza�hlung-2.jpg: Duplicate file detected
2015/05/19 16:55:47
Transferred:            0 Bytes (   0.00 kByte/s)
Errors:                 0
Checks:                 0
Transferred:            0
Elapsed time:  2m0.541802319s

[...]

Transferred:       418806 Bytes (   1.90 kByte/s)
Errors:                 0
Checks:             23383
Transferred:            1
Elapsed time:  3m34.820251669s
```

A fourth synchronization finishes without errors, and two duplicate files (well, actually occurs twice the message of "Duplicate file detected" for the same file as in the previous synchronization)

```
[...]

2015/05/19 17:02:11 zahnarzt.berlin.to/20150518/tree/fileadmin/user_upload/right_images/Zahntechnik_Aufza�hlung-2.jpg: Duplicate file detected
2015/05/19 17:02:11 zahnarzt.berlin.to/20150518/tree/fileadmin/user_upload/right_images/Zahntechnik_Aufza�hlung-2.jpg: Duplicate file detected

[...]

Transferred:       418806 Bytes (   1.91 kByte/s)
Errors:                 0
Checks:             23383
Transferred:            1
Elapsed time:  3m33.884934348s
```

In the fifth synchronization no errors occur and the message appears three times for the same file:

```
[...]

2015/05/19 17:10:44 zahnarzt.berlin.to/20150518/tree/fileadmin/user_upload/right_images/Zahntechnik_Aufza�hlung-2.jpg: Duplicate file detected
2015/05/19 17:10:44 zahnarzt.berlin.to/20150518/tree/fileadmin/user_upload/right_images/Zahntechnik_Aufza�hlung-2.jpg: Duplicate file detected
2015/05/19 17:10:44 zahnarzt.berlin.to/20150518/tree/fileadmin/user_upload/right_images/Zahntechnik_Aufza�hlung-2.jpg: Duplicate file detected

Transferred:       418806 Bytes (   1.85 kByte/s)
Errors:                 0
Checks:             23383
Transferred:            1
Elapsed time:  3m41.525118259s
[...]
```

Then appears four times:

```
[...]

2015/05/19 17:23:56 zahnarzt.berlin.to/20150518/tree/fileadmin/user_upload/right_images/Zahntechnik_Aufza�hlung-2.jpg: Duplicate file detected
2015/05/19 17:23:56 zahnarzt.berlin.to/20150518/tree/fileadmin/user_upload/right_images/Zahntechnik_Aufza�hlung-2.jpg: Duplicate file detected
2015/05/19 17:23:56 zahnarzt.berlin.to/20150518/tree/fileadmin/user_upload/right_images/Zahntechnik_Aufza�hlung-2.jpg: Duplicate file detected
2015/05/19 17:23:56 zahnarzt.berlin.to/20150518/tree/fileadmin/user_upload/right_images/Zahntechnik_Aufza�hlung-2.jpg: Duplicate file detected

[...]

Transferred:       418806 Bytes (   1.75 kByte/s)
Errors:                 0
Checks:             23383
Transferred:            1
Elapsed time:  3m53.376848836s
```

In a subsequent synchronization occurs five times.

Please tell me if I can help with something else.

Best regards,
Daniel

Very interesting - thank you.

Drive seems to have some quite serious rate limiting.  It will take large files very quickly but it doesn't like lots of small files.  In my testing the limit is about 2 per second which agrees quite well with your initial transfer.

The second transfer cleaned up the errors as expected, then in that and subsequent transfers it is uploading the same file again and again, duplicating it each time.

The problem almost certainly ocurred during the initial transfer.

So
- rclone doesn't think that file has been uploaded for some reason
- so it transfers it again
- however it was there so becomes duplicated

Once you have a duplicate then I can see a mechanism for you getting another on each transfer.

Questions
- That file has a non ASCII character in it.  Is it the only one or are there others with that character in?
- Can you do an `rclone lsl remote:Backup/ps382038.dreamhostps.com` and grep out the lines which mention that file and post them here?  I'd expect there to be 5 or so.
- Can you use the drive web interface to verify that the there are the same number and sizes of that file? I'm hoping there will be one more...

Thanks

Nick

Hi, Nick.

Thanks for your reply.

> Drive seems to have some quite serious rate limiting. It will take large files very quickly but it doesn't like lots of small files. In my testing the limit is about 2 per second which agrees quite well with your initial transfer.

2 Kbytes per second which agrees quite well with me initial transfer? Sorry, but I'm not sure if I understood this since the final transfer rate was 238.09 Kbytes/s in the initial transfer. At this time I can not confirm the transfer rate at the beginning of the initial transfer (I'm working inside a GNU screen session and that is beyond the capacity of the buffer) but I think it was much higher (700 KB/s or so, which at times it was down quite --- I guess due to the rate limit).

> - Can you do an rclone lsl remote:Backup/ps382038.dreamhostps.com and grep out the lines which mention that file and post them here? I'd expect there to be 5 or so.

This is the output I get:

```

   492771 2010-08-11 12:55:58.000000000 zahnarzt.berlin.to/20150518/tree/fileadmin/user_upload/right_images/Zahntechnik_Aufzahlung-3.jpg
2015/05/20 05:03:51 
Transferred:            0 Bytes (   0.00 kByte/s)
Errors:                 0
Checks:             10854

2015/05/20 05:04:51

Transferred:            0 Bytes (   0.00 kByte/s)

```

I think the first seven files are what interest us.

> - Can you use the drive web interface to verify that the there are the same number and sizes of that file? I'm hoping there will be one more...
> - That file has a non ASCII character in it. Is it the only one or are there others with that character in?

I will check it and will answer as soon as possible.

Thanks for your time.

Best regards,
Daniel

Thanks for the update - look forward to seeing the rest of the answers :-)

In the mean time

> 2 Kbytes per second which agrees quite well with me initial transfer?

That is 2 **files** per second max, not 2 kBytes/s.  Your initial transfer was

```
Transferred:  23384
Elapsed time: 3h12m23.442490003s
```

Which is 2.03 files / second

Hi, Nick.

Thanks for your answer.

> That is 2 files per second max, not 2 kBytes/s. Your initial transfer was
> 
> ```
> Transferred:  23384
> Elapsed time: 3h12m23.442490003s
> ```
> 
> Which is 2.03 files / second

Ah, good. Thanks for the clarification :-)

Best regards,
Daniel

@dbareiro I would try this option in your rClone command to limit number of
simultaneous transfers to only one.

--transfers=1

Hi, zeshanb.

Thanks for your answer.

I'm trying doing a complete transfer again using your suggestion of `--transfers = 1`. Until now (first 30 minutes) I had no messages about `User rate limit exceeded`.

```
Transferred:    283505324 Bytes ( 153.73 kByte/s)
Errors:                 0
Checks:                 0
Transferred:         1486
Elapsed time:  30m0.901450541s
Transferring:  kg.berlin.to/20150518/tree/fileadmin/user_upload/girls/petronela/010.JPG
```

I will keep you aware of the results.

Best regards,
Daniel

Hi, Nick. 

Let me come back to this topic leaving aside for a moment the issue of the errors, please:

> Drive seems to have some quite serious rate limiting.

Let me see if I understand. This limitation has nothing to do with the implementation of `rclone` itself, but will be a limitation that would affect any client attempting to connect to Google Drive, right?

In the latter case, I think it would be impractical try to use Google Drive as a repository for transfer of high volume of data. That is, now I'm trying to transfer the backup of only two sites (2.5 GB). But if I wanted to transfer the backup of all sites (30 GB or so), transfer times would be extremely high and would make this impractical.

Although perhaps there is some other storage system (compatible with `rclone`) which does not have this strong limitation on the transfer rate that has Google Drive.

Best regards,
Daniel

Hi, Nick/Zeshanb.

After having a complete new transfer, these are the final statistics:

```
# ./rclone copy /space/backup/ps382038.dreamhostps.com remote:Backup/ps382038.dreamhostps.com --transfers=1
[...]
Transferred:   5498233517 Bytes ( 165.89 kByte/s)
Errors:                57
Checks:                 0
Transferred:        46764
Elapsed time:  8h59m27.377922392s
```

Then I do a second synchronization which sends the files involved in the errors, I think:

```
# ./rclone copy /space/backup/ps382038.dreamhostps.com remote:Backup/ps382038.dreamhostps.com --transfers=1
[...]
Transferred:      2245751 Bytes (   3.35 kByte/s)
Errors:                 0

In the third transfer has appeared the same file with non-ASCII characters in the previous test, but strangely this has shown two duplicate messages directly. But looking more closely, it is logical that this happens because it is the file that is in the backup of each day (20150518 and 20150519).

```
# ./rclone copy /space/backup/ps382038.dreamhostps.com remote:Backup/ps382038.dreamhostps.com --transfers=1
[...]
2015/05/20 17:35:56 zahnarzt.berlin.to/20150519/tree/fileadmin/user_upload/right_images/Zahntechnik_Aufza�hlung-2.jpg: Duplicate file detected

```
# ./rclone copy /space/backup/ps382038.dreamhostps.com/zahnarzt.berlin.to/20150518 remote:Backup/ps382038.dreamhostps.com/zahnarzt.berlin.to/20150518 --transfers=1

```

Unfortunately `--transfers=1` does not seem to make any difference. :(

As I said in an earlier message, during the initial transfer also I found these errors (besides the drawback of `User rate limit exceeded`):

```
2015/05/20 09:15:03 kg.berlin.to/20150518/tree/typo3conf/ext/templavoila/Documentation/ExtTemplavoila/NewContentElementWizard/Index.rst: Failed to copy: Couldn't find or make directory: Couldn't list directory: googleapi: Error 401: Invalid Credentials, authError
```

On the other hand, this time I have not had messages of duplicate files with ASCII characters, as in the initial post of this issue so I think there may be other reasons why this problem occurs. What do you think?

Best regards,
Daniel

@dbareiro Thanks for you replies and testing!

> > Drive seems to have some quite serious rate limiting.
> 
> Let me see if I understand. This limitation has nothing to do with the implementation of rclone itself, but will be a limitation that would affect any client attempting to connect to Google Drive, right?

That is correct.

> In the latter case, I think it would be impractical try to use Google Drive as a repository for transfer of high volume of data. That is, now I'm trying to transfer the backup of only two sites (2.5 GB). But if I wanted to transfer the backup of all sites (30 GB or so), transfer times would be extremely high and would make this impractical.

Note that it is only the upload of new files that appears to be rate limited.  So if you are repeatedly copying the same filesystem structure then rclone will only copy the differences and this will be quick provided not too many files have changed - that is what I'd recommend.

Note that I'm planning to make a `--retry` flag which will automatically retry if there were errors in the transfer which would automate this process.

I'm halfway through making a server side copy command which would mean you could do bandwidth efficient daily backups like this (without downloading everything and uploading it to copy it which is what will happen if you try these commands with the current rclone!)

```
# Do the sync - this will be an incremental
rclone sync /path/to/directory drive:backup/current
# Make a copy with todays date
rclone copy drive:backup/current drive:backup/201505021
```

> Although perhaps there is some other storage system (compatible with rclone) which does not have this strong limitation on the transfer rate that has Google Drive.

None of the other rclone backends have this limitation. There are loads of swift providers (Memset Memstore, Rackspace Cloud Files, Runabove, etc) which are reasonably priced.  There is also Google 
 Cloud Storage and Amazon S3.

---

Thanks for trying out with `--transfers=1`.

---

The mostly likely cause of duplicate files does seem to be the non ASCII characters...  rclone can handle UTF-8 characters just fine, but it looks like you have a character in the latin1 encoding since it isn't showing properly in my browser...

**I've managed to replicate the problem**  - attempting to transfer an invalid utf-8 filename seems to cause the problem.  So what is happening is your filesystem encoding for file names is set to latin1 - however rclone assumes it is utf-8 so is reading what is invalid utf-8 strings and sending them to drive.  Drive doesn't like them so it converts them into the invalid unicode character '\ufffd'.  So when rclone reads the files back the name it is expecting isn't there and it uploads it again.

Solutions for rclone...
- rclone can do this substitution itself - that will fix the problem however it is losing the meaning of the latin1 encoded files
  - [encoding of file names](http://unix.stackexchange.com/questions/2089/what-charset-encoding-is-used-for-filenames-and-paths-on-linux) is a bit of a mess on linux
  - [mac encoding](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/9757843/unicode-encoding-for-filesystem-in-mac-os-x-not-correct-in-python)
  - [windows](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/2050973/what-encoding-are-filenames-in-ntfs-stored-as)

I need to check whether Go translates windows/mac filenames into UTF-8 (I think it does).

Which platform are you using? Win/Mac/Linux?  And where was that file created?

I have fixed this issue in v1.14 (hopefully!)

Can you give it a test and re-open the ticket if necessary

Thanks for helping me narrow it down

-- Nick

issue.title: drive: multiple files of same name being created

milestone.title: Known Problem
milestone.description: This milestone contains issues which are known problems which are proving difficult to fix, or are awaiting an external fix or we haven't got round to yet.

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
Great tool! Thanks for all your work on this and making it available. 

Using `rclone sync` to a drive location, I'm seeing many copies of the same file/same name being created. Saw in the release notes that this was a fix in 1.06, but I've only ever used versions 1.07 and 1.09 (just downloaded 1.10 and will try that as well). 

Possible causes include: 
- interrupted transfers? (it's a huge directory and hasn't finished)
- maybe the deletions only occur after a sync is successful/complete?

Any thoughts?

body:
Hi, Nick.

Thanks for your reply.

> > Let me see if I understand. This limitation has nothing to do with the implementation of rclone itself, but will be a limitation that would affect any client attempting to connect to Google Drive, right?
> 
> That is correct.

Thanks for the clarification.

> >  In the latter case, I think it would be impractical try to use Google Drive as a repository for transfer of high volume of data. That is, now I'm trying to transfer the backup of only two sites (2.5 GB). But if I wanted to transfer the backup of all sites (30 GB or so), transfer times would be extremely high and would make this impractical.
> 
> Note that it is only the upload of new files that appears to be rate limited. So if you are repeatedly copying the same filesystem structure then rclone will only copy the differences and this will be quick provided not too many files have changed - that is what I'd recommend.

Yes, it works like `rsync`, as stated on the site (`rsync` for cloud storage) :-). I think I had it in mind. But my idea was to keep a history of backups per day. For this I was using a backup server which synchronized sites on a remote server with [Dirvish](http://www.dirvish.org) (do you know Dirvish?), minimizing the disk space used by implementing hardlinks to files that do not change regarding to the previous backup. But Google is not aware of this. For Drive these files in each directory are a full copy, which prolongs the time of transfer. But I think I've found a way to reduce the transfer time to Google. I make a tarball of each daily image generated by Dirvish and then I upload that images to Drive. Check this out:

```
# ./rclone copy /space/tarbackup_tmp remote:Backup/ps382038.dreamhostps.com
2015/05/21 11:27:23 Google drive root 'Backup/ps382038.dreamhostps.com': Building file list
2015/05/21 11:27:23 Google drive root 'Backup/ps382038.dreamhostps.com': Waiting for checks to finish
2015/05/21 11:27:23 Google drive root 'Backup/ps382038.dreamhostps.com': Waiting for transfers to finish
2015/05/21 11:28:23
Transferred:    968097792 Bytes (15608.61 kByte/s)
Errors:                 0
Checks:                 0
Transferred:            0
Elapsed time:  1m0.569663993s
Transferring:  kg.berlin.to_20150518.tar.gz, kg.berlin.to_20150519.tar.gz, kg.berlin.to_20150520.tar.gz, zahnarzt.berlin.to_20150518.tar.gz

2015/05/21 11:29:23
Transferred:   1848886861 Bytes (14974.61 kByte/s)
Errors:                 0
Checks:                 0
Transferred:            1
Elapsed time:  2m0.57433242s
Transferring:  kg.berlin.to_20150518.tar.gz, kg.berlin.to_20150519.tar.gz, kg.berlin.to_20150520.tar.gz, zahnarzt.berlin.to_20150519.tar.gz

2015/05/21 11:30:23
Transferred:   2803091021 Bytes (15159.67 kByte/s)
Errors:                 0
Checks:                 0
Transferred:            1
Elapsed time:  3m0.570781467s
Transferring:  kg.berlin.to_20150520.tar.gz, zahnarzt.berlin.to_20150519.tar.gz, kg.berlin.to_20150518.tar.gz, kg.berlin.to_20150519.tar.gz

2015/05/21 11:31:23
Transferred:   3693325507 Bytes (14992.48 kByte/s)
Errors:                 0
Checks:                 0
Transferred:            2
Elapsed time:  4m0.571558404s
Transferring:  kg.berlin.to_20150518.tar.gz, kg.berlin.to_20150519.tar.gz, kg.berlin.to_20150520.tar.gz, zahnarzt.berlin.to_20150520.tar.gz

2015/05/21 11:32:23
Transferred:   4534283459 Bytes (14731.94 kByte/s)
Errors:                 0
Checks:                 0
Transferred:            2
Elapsed time:  5m0.572198965s
Transferring:  kg.berlin.to_20150518.tar.gz, kg.berlin.to_20150519.tar.gz, kg.berlin.to_20150520.tar.gz, zahnarzt.berlin.to_20150520.tar.gz

2015/05/21 11:33:23
Transferred:   5273837502 Bytes (14283.32 kByte/s)
Errors:                 0
Checks:                 0
Transferred:            3
Elapsed time:  6m0.57660518s
Transferring:  kg.berlin.to_20150518.tar.gz, kg.berlin.to_20150519.tar.gz, kg.berlin.to_20150520.tar.gz

2015/05/21 11:34:23
Transferred:   5872836542 Bytes (13636.59 kByte/s)
Errors:                 0
Checks:                 0
Transferred:            3
Elapsed time:  7m0.573628968s
Transferring:  kg.berlin.to_20150518.tar.gz, kg.berlin.to_20150519.tar.gz, kg.berlin.to_20150520.tar.gz

2015/05/21 11:35:23
Transferred:   6472622014 Bytes (13152.96 kByte/s)
Errors:                 0
Checks:                 0
Transferred:            3
Elapsed time:  8m0.570143115s
Transferring:  kg.berlin.to_20150518.tar.gz, kg.berlin.to_20150519.tar.gz, kg.berlin.to_20150520.tar.gz

2015/05/21 11:36:23
Transferred:   7047329645 Bytes (12731.09 kByte/s)
Errors:                 0
Checks:                 0
Transferred:            3
Elapsed time:  9m0.57880906s
Transferring:  kg.berlin.to_20150518.tar.gz, kg.berlin.to_20150519.tar.gz, kg.berlin.to_20150520.tar.gz


Transferred:   7138866563 Bytes (12321.15 kByte/s)
Errors:                 0
Checks:                 0
Transferred:            6
Elapsed time:  9m25.819635937s
```

Thus I did not get the message `User rate limit exceeded` or `Invalid Credentials, authError`

> Note that I'm planning to make a --retry flag which will automatically retry if there were errors in the transfer which would automate this process.

That would be great! :-)

> I'm halfway through making a server side copy command which would mean you could do bandwidth efficient daily backups like this (without downloading everything and uploading it to copy it which is what will happen if you try these commands with the current rclone!)

This sounds interesting. Could you elaborate a bit more about how it would work?

> ```
> # Do the sync - this will be an incremental
> rclone sync /path/to/directory drive:backup/current
> # Make a copy with todays date
> rclone copy drive:backup/current drive:backup/201505021
> ```

It has not been clear to me how this works in each of the two cases. `sync` would be a new option that you will implement? Because on the [documentation](http://rclone.org/drive/) I've only seen `copy` for Google Drive. For the second case I think you are copying the contents of a directory to another directory within the same account of Google Drive. But in the first case I'm not sure what it does.

> > Although perhaps there is some other storage system (compatible with rclone) which does not have this strong limitation on the transfer rate that has Google Drive.
> 
> None of the other rclone backends have this limitation. There are loads of swift providers (Memset Memstore, Rackspace Cloud Files, Runabove, etc) which are reasonably priced. There is also Google Cloud Storage and Amazon S3.

Just I chose the one that is limited. What a bad luck :-D But it is expected that the services are paid do not have these limitations. When you talk about _swift providers_ you mean services using [this](https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Swift) protocol?

> The mostly likely cause of duplicate files does seem to be the non ASCII characters... rclone can handle UTF-8 characters just fine, but it looks like you have a character in the latin1 encoding since it isn't showing properly in my browser...

But these files with non-ASCII characters can generate duplicates only when they themselves try to be transferred or can it generate duplicates on files without no-ASCII characters too? Because I still do not understand what may have been the cause of duplicate files without non-ASCII character mentioned in the initial message of this issue.

> I've managed to replicate the problem - attempting to transfer an invalid utf-8 filename seems to cause the problem. So what is happening is your filesystem encoding for file names is set to latin1 - however rclone assumes it is utf-8 so is reading what is invalid utf-8 strings and sending them to drive. Drive doesn't like them so it converts them into the invalid unicode character '\ufffd'. So when rclone reads the files back the name it is expecting isn't there and it uploads it again.

It is a great news that you could replicate this and already you have a new version that fixes this bug. I appreciate your time and it is also a pleasure to have contributed reporting this problem.

These are the `locales` that I'm using on the backup server, which matches with the `locales` used on the server that maintains the sites. As I said before, the files are synchronized by the backup server using Dirvish (`rsync`). Responding to one of your questions, both are GNU/Linux.

```
# locale
LANG=
LANGUAGE=
LC_CTYPE="POSIX"
LC_NUMERIC="POSIX"
LC_TIME="POSIX"
LC_COLLATE="POSIX"
LC_MONETARY="POSIX"
LC_MESSAGES="POSIX"
LC_PAPER="POSIX"
LC_NAME="POSIX"
LC_ADDRESS="POSIX"
LC_TELEPHONE="POSIX"
LC_MEASUREMENT="POSIX"
LC_IDENTIFICATION="POSIX"
LC_ALL=
```

Regarding to where was that file created, I could not confirm. The file was an image (Zahntechnik_Aufza�hlung-2.jpg) so maybe it could have been created by a designer in his own computer.

Thanks again for your time.

Best regards,
Daniel

issue.title: Error installing rclone from GitHub

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
Hi, Nick.

Maybe you can help me with this error. I do not think it's a problem of `rclone` itself, but some dependency that is not installed. I'm using Debian GNU/Linux Jessie.

```
# aptitude install golang git gcc
```

Then:

```
# go install github.com/ncw/rclone
# github.com/ncw/rclone/googlecloudstorage
go/src/github.com/ncw/rclone/googlecloudstorage/googlecloudstorage.go:45: undefined: storage.DevstorageFull_controlScope
```

Maybe I'm missing to install some Go library?

Thanks in advance.

Best regards,
Daniel

issue.title: User rate limit exceeded, userRateLimitExceeded

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
For some reason this has started happening to me  Received error: Upload failed - retry: googleapi: Error 403: User rate limit exceeded, userRateLimitExceeded - retrying 2/10
I have set my own key and secret so  dont use all your call as i work in schools and have found this to be real good. at time of running quota 
Free quota 10,000,000 requests/day 
Remaining 9,998,919 requests/day
99.99% of total
Per-user limit 250 requests/second/user
